website_summaries.verdict: A timeless musical instrument set that encourages musical exploration. Unbeatable quality that lives up to the brand name.
pros: With premium craftsmanship and a focus on sound quality places, this set is head and shoulders above similar kits
Children can play by themselves or form a band
Durable construction is built to last
cons: Better suited to children over the age of 3
However, with supervision younger kids can enjoy it, too

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return for full refund
customer_reviews.text: The kazoo barely works, barely, and is not useful for children. The xylophone doesn't make much music - it's very dull and monotone wood on wood sound. If my kids hadn't already tried out the instruments, aka spit and banged on them, I would have sent them back. But then again, there's no way to test the item without doing that so I guess we're stuck with over-priced wooden blocks to take up space in the toy box. I will try to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: All good except the xylophone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set because the picture looks like a wooden xylophone (which I prefer bc it’s a softer, somewhat muted sound) - so I assumed my would be the same Melissa and Doug set our library has. The xylophone we received has metal keys instead, though, and 2 of the keys are very nearly the same sound. The other instruments work fine, but I was sorely disappointed with the xylophone
customer_reviews.author: A. T.

customer_reviews.title: Flashy, but terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a flashy present but once you start playing the instruments you realize that there are no actual pitches or notes on any of it except the harmonica. Also, the square pallet fell off the peg within minutes of playing with it. Not good quality at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very big let down
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. 1/2 the stuff doesn't work. Kazoo won't make noise. Xylophone 2 of the bars makes no sound. Many parts are ruff and would need to be sanded. I had them send a replacement item and it was the same thing. Not work the amount charged. Very disappointed and prob will reconsider buying Doug and Melissa products.
customer_reviews.author: bizecky

customer_reviews.title: Decent set.
customer_reviews.text: For the most part Melissa and Doug make great toys. The harmonica in this set is really cheap. You could do better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good set, except for the harmonica
customer_reviews.text: The Xylophone in this set is crap. It just sounds like wood hitting wood and almost no musical note comes out at all. I think if they put some rubber washers in between it would work better but I'm not sure. The kazoo in my set might have been broken when I got it because it makes no sound. The harmonica is the only redeeming piece in this set, as it is a pretty good one for the price. You should just buy a harmonica separately if you want one though, and skip this set completely. This is a definite "don't buy".
customer_reviews.author: Trogd00r

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control for xylophone.
customer_reviews.text: I do understand that these are toys and not professional instruments, but the xylophone is terrible! It doesn't follow the expected scale and the last 3 keys ( out of 8) are the same tone. Very disappointed because M&D toys are usually our preferred choice.
customer_reviews.author: JGS444

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any music lover no matter the age!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 1st birthday because he was so interested in music and to this day (he's 2.5 yrs.) he still plays with all of it! He loved the clappers for the car rides when he was a baby and he chewed on only those instead of the traditional chew toys!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: but is probably a good idea with a baby who likes to bang up ...
customer_reviews.text: The xylophone is made of wood, which is a little corny to play with, but is probably a good idea with a baby who likes to bang up things. If you really want a musical toy for your kids to enjoy playing with, I would suggest getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: A. Aguila

customer_reviews.title: Okay but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: We love this kit - all except for the kazoo and castanets. The kazoo never worked and also is made of wood and not sanded properly. Even if it had functioned - I would not have let my daughter play with it for fear of splinters. The castanets are great - but not for a young child. I question them being put in a beginner band set - as they need to be worn on your hands to use and are not easy for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa

customer_reviews.title: Fun First Instruments
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really like this set. My almost 2-year old son loves playing all of the instruments - he even plays the harmonica. There are two negatives - the harmonica has tiny screws and one fell out on day two probably. And, because the xylophone is wooden, the sound is not great, a little muted. I wish it was metal - although I know then it would not be a Melissa and Doug.
customer_reviews.author: CRamon

customer_reviews.title: Nephew's Delight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old nephew's birthday. He LOVES it and it helps keep him from banging on the windows!
customer_reviews.author: jazzybess

customer_reviews.title: l love Melissa and Doug toys but for this specific one
customer_reviews.text: l love Melissa and Doug toys but for this specific one, the recorder doesn't make any sound so its useless and also the cords come of easily and tightens so hard from the round finger bells.
customer_reviews.author: Melek

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing set
customer_reviews.text: We typically love Melissa and Doug toys, but this one was a disappointment. The unpainted wood is not as smooth as M&D toys usually are, everything feels light and flimsy, and the quality is nowhere near our Band in a Box from M&D. I wouldn't recommend this set. (The harmonica, however, is well made and works great!)
customer_reviews.author: ermaca

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids.
customer_reviews.text: My 19 month old son really likes thes the harmonica and kazoo.I did not think he could work he kazoo and harmonica but he does. He enoys it. The castanets and clacker however I am not as happy with. The elastic string knot is easy for my toddler to untie and take apart. The xlaphones is nice but the metal ones make better noise.
customer_reviews.author: Cherisha M Ferrigno

customer_reviews.title: worth the noise
customer_reviews.text: Not high quality, in the least. But it works well for a 3 year old wanting to make music. We can all have fun making noise as a family. Bought this 6 months ago and everything still works as day one. Just not great sound quality to begin with. Will be able to pass on with out too much wear showing through.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of One

customer_reviews.title: Melissa &Doug toys are my favorite to buy for my nieces
customer_reviews.text: Melissa &Doug toys are my favorite to buy for my nieces. This one was pretty good. Usually the wood element is what attracts me to them but in this case the wood doesn't make for the best instruments. Good enough for kids though and still glad its not plastic!
customer_reviews.author: cherylboberyl

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A lot of fun for the grandkids. They make noise, but not too much noise.
customer_reviews.author: tell family

customer_reviews.title: You're better off just buying something a little pricier that will ...
customer_reviews.text: the harmonica and xylophone are both ridiculously cheap and honestly not musical at all. You're better off just buying something a little pricier that will actually be melodic.
customer_reviews.author: Lv

customer_reviews.title: Everything's wood except the harmonica so expect the sound of wood, not music
customer_reviews.text: The xylphone is made of wood (not meta) so there's really no musical notes other than some plunking sounds. The kazoo was useless. Harmonica was ok. Not exactly what I expected and my kids played with them for a couple of days and quickly lost interest.
customer_reviews.author: Quan

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves musical instruments, but this one isn't really exciting her. The quality is okay. I don't see them holding up as well as metal instruments. The kazoo is somewhat unusual and she is afraid of it for now. Maybe she is just a bit too young for this set and will grow into it. This was just an okay purchase. We're not enjoying it as much as our other Melissa & Doug toys.
customer_reviews.author: NDEc

customer_reviews.title: Delightful
customer_reviews.text: I love how my child lights uo with excitement everytime she plays with this toy. It is durable, and fun for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Megan E Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: It's durable, but as musical instruments go, none of these are very good. My 2-yr-old likes the kazoo. The harmonica isn't even real or tuned at all, just plays random noises/tones, which was really disappointing. I'll keep it because it makes noise and toddlers like that, but I wouldn't recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased a few M&D items and they are nice but the quality of this band set was so-so. There was a lot of wood filler used in the construction of these items. They used some of the cheapest poor quality wood you could find. BUT for the price what can you expect. Our daughter loves to play the harmonica and other items.
customer_reviews.author: travel23

customer_reviews.title: Xylophone is out of tune
customer_reviews.text: Not up to the normal "Melissa and Doug" quality, I don't expect symphony quality from this, but the top note is lower than the previous note.
customer_reviews.author: practical_tactical

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I'm developing "Mr
customer_reviews.text: The 2 year old that I got it for loves to play with the instruments. I feel like I'm developing "Mr. Holland's Opus" in my living room!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Shichtman

customer_reviews.title: Good except for the mallet
customer_reviews.text: The wooden mallet that you use to play the xylophone should have been round instead of square at the top because it leaves little nicks in the wood and paint. The rest of the toys, so far, are good. Only had them for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: sassie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very fun for tots! My nephew was one and loved playing with these!
customer_reviews.author: Amizon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Such a disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: So I should have read the 1 star reviews more closely because they are totally accurate. The xylophone makes no sound, the harmonica barely works, and the little clappers barely make sound! Such a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Horton

customer_reviews.title: All the instruments are poor quality and non-functional
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst purchase I've ever made for my 1 year old boy. The harmonica is a joke, the whistle doesn't work at all and the xylophone (which was the main reason I bought this toy) is the worst xylophone I've ever heard. You'd be better off buying a cheap little toy plastic xylophone. The only thing that works is the tambourine type thing, which is actually functional. I would not buy this toy. The pine is cheap and unfinished. It is a low quality, worthless collection of pieces of junk. It is sad because I really like the Melissa & Doug puzzles. Don't buy this... You'll be sorry if you do!
customer_reviews.author: Reed Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I'd pass ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 years old thinks it's pretty cool but gets bored with it fast. None of the instruments sound very good and the harmonica barely makes a noise.
customer_reviews.author: RadMom

customer_reviews.title: Love this set of musical instruments
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a friend's child and she appeared to enjoy playing with it, so am planning to get another for our granddaughter. Not for houses where noise is an issue. Such a joyful noise is made with these kid sized music makers!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy D. Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Essentially scrap wood
customer_reviews.text: This should be called "Pieces of wood and an out of tune harmonica" The xylophone is muted and out of key, the harmonica is in no discernible key, the kazoo is a piece of wood with no apparent musical properties. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: NYC SAHM

customer_reviews.title: Some parts are fun
customer_reviews.text: Its well made and has held up to abuse well. The harmonica and xylophone are the only 2 items my daughter likes. The kazoo is hard to use, or maybe just broken. Other items don't get any use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: For musical children
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a kazoo for my almost-3 yr old when i came across this set. Was a little surprised at the negative reviews, but trusted Melissa & Doug to provide a quality product. The set was a hit with both the girls (3 and 1) - the little one figured out the maracas right away and loved the jingly shaker. The 3 yr old figured out the kazoo in one go, and liked the xylophone and the harmonica. Your musical children will love this set.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Melissa and Doug items period! They are all awesome! And these instruments are perfect for children to experience different types of sounds and work on their motor skills with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Epic Fail
customer_reviews.text: Kept wrapped as a gift beyond the return date or this would have gone straight back to the seller! Worst construction wooden toy ever. None of the music makers except the harmonica worked to create any kind of sound. More time was spent on the packaging than the product. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Almquist

customer_reviews.title: these are toys, not real instruments
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I like Melissa & Doug toys in general but this was not worth it. If you want to buy your child some instruments that can actually produce sound in key then this is not for you. If you want to buy your child a toy that looks like an instrument and do not care what sound it makes then this will work. The kazoo is a joke. The xylophone is barely acceptable. The harmonica could make your ears bleed.
customer_reviews.author: Corrin M.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy. There are sharp edges and the xylophone ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. Not a good buy. There are sharp edges and the xylophone is made of wood. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: evescam

customer_reviews.title: cute musical set!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my two year old, he loves music...he hasn't used it a lot yet,but he goes from new toys to old ones all the time... I like the quality,the price... we have other toys by melissa & doug and we like them all!
customer_reviews.author: carmen

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 year son. He really likes the harmonica. It's his favorite. He also likes the xyliphone. The castanedas and the shaker are not as fun. The kazoo does not seem to work very well. It is a durable set. Overall, we are pleased with this set for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Disapponting
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this set overall- the xylophone is all wood and hardly makes any noise. The kazoo (?) is totally worthless as well. Neither one produces anything close to music. I agree with the other reviews that the set looks cheaply made and many of the instruments are poor. The clickers, cymbals and harmonica are all ok, but not great. Not a fun toy.
customer_reviews.author: Cmboyd

customer_reviews.title: better to get the individual pieces at any store
customer_reviews.text: The whole set is junk. If you want a musical instrument, better to get the individual pieces at any store. Cheap, no sound. Only thing that works ok is the harmonica.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Long-term fun for your kid
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. Not many of her toys continue to be used after a while, but these have stoodd the test of time. Not the most amazing quality, but they're tough enough to last.
customer_reviews.author: TheDhuddist

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our son is having a great time playing with this set and the pieces are nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: J. Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Lots of great times with Great Grandson
customer_reviews.text: Have had this item for quite some time, we have had so much fun with it. Had our own marching band taking turns playing each item.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Threet

customer_reviews.title: The wood is too light weight and the sound not as strong as I would like.
customer_reviews.text: Well made but not the music quality I was looking for. The wood is too light weight and the sound not as strong as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Suziladi99

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality. Completely out of tune xylophone and harmonica ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. Completely out of tune xylophone and harmonica is completely useless. Don't know why they even bother to make an instrument for children, if they are out of tune.
customer_reviews.author: Yayoi Lagerqvist

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift I got for my granddaughter. She enjoys musical instruments and all of them calls her attention, specially the harmonica which her father wanted to start using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect gift for the inlaws
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my inlaws as pay back for all of the crap they drop off at my house. The kids make a ton of noise ALL day with this. Not just for revenge- the kids love it too.
customer_reviews.author: GNS3

customer_reviews.title: sufficiently annoying
customer_reviews.text: This set of toys seems to both amuse my small niece as well as annoy the heck out of my sister. That's all I was asking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I chose this rating because it is really well made and everything is nice except the kazoo. The kazoo doesn't do anything. It's completely hollow and doesn't make a sound. Other than that the rest of the instruments are are great!
customer_reviews.author: Jaella Preseau

customer_reviews.title: 2 of the 5 instruments were let-downs
customer_reviews.text: The Xylophone doesn't sound great and the kazoo thing didn't work at all. Not the best musical instrument set out there.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen L. Henschen

customer_reviews.title: We would probably enjoy this more if we didn't have musicians in the ...
customer_reviews.text: We would probably enjoy this more if we didn't have musicians in the family. Is it possible to tune a xylophone?
customer_reviews.author: biblioholic1228

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fun
customer_reviews.text: This set has been a lot of fun! I have 4 very active children, 3 of whom are boys. This set has held up well for everything they have thrown at it almost a year later. It has been a nice addition to our music time.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Norris

customer_reviews.title: Love the wooden toys
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is playing with these each time I go over to my sister in laws house, I think that is self explanatory.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product. good price. fast shipping. probably better for slightly younger children.
customer_reviews.author: Bama

customer_reviews.title: WE LOVE MELISSA & DOUG PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: 9 month old immediately picked up the mallet and began banging on the wooden xylophone. We do not leave her alone with the bells, not yet, if she fell on those, it would not be a pretty sight. I realize she is a little young for all these instruments, but she will grow into them. In the meantime, the colorful xylophone is a household sound. Keep in mind, these are WOOD, they do not make the tinny "ting" sound of metal or plastic. These "thud". Its much more pleasant to the ears. :)
customer_reviews.author: jam

customer_reviews.title: She loved it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my niece! She loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Briana R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this band set for my 18 month old grandson who seems to like music. While he hasn't mastered any Beethoven symphonies yet, he has great fun with the various items and makes quite a racket !! I highly recommend this item for any child who likes music or just likes making the different sounds. Everything is very well constructed and will still be in one piece long after the child has outgrown it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa47

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Cute idea but very very poor quality. The only thing we use is the tambourine.
customer_reviews.author: BEESKNEES

customer_reviews.title: This particulare set is good but they have better sets
customer_reviews.text: I like Melissa and Doug. The xylophone in this set is harder to use because its wood, but everything else in it is perfecto and the other band in a box choices melissa and doug offer are awesome. The one with the maracas and trampoline is great!! The xylophohe is the only thing they should modify and they're pricing is cheaper than the competitior. It is durable and my son is one that puts every product to the test!
customer_reviews.author: Guesswho

customer_reviews.title: The kazoo does not work!
customer_reviews.text: The kazoo is just a piece of wood that does absolutely nothing
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Mathias Silva

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ENTERTAINER FOR NEW BORN
customer_reviews.text: I play the instruments to my baby since she was 6 weeks old. She LOVES the xylophone as I play in tune to her audio music. She will be using it when she is older. Only thing is the bazooka/flute? It is useless, splintery and has a funny smell. Everything else is great.
customer_reviews.author: upsydaisy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful combination of instruments
customer_reviews.text: I knew the Beginner Band Set was a little old for our one year-old grandson, but he loves the xylophone and mallet and the jingles. He will grow into the kazoo and harmonica, but I loved the variety of instruments. . The quality of the wooden instruments is excellent - I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne H. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for 2 2 year old . He lovesmaking music and it is sturdy enough to take all the banging he does with them
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Gilberts

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this music set for my toddler and when it arrived I was really happy with the quality and durability of the product. It looks just like the photo on Amazon and comes in a great wooden box. I know my child will have a lot of fun with it come Christmas! I have always been happy with the line of Melissa and Doug products and plan to order more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: L. Soule

customer_reviews.title: Extremely cheaply made, most of them do not make any noisy that even resembles music.
customer_reviews.text: This was inexpensive and still not worth the money. Extremely cheaply made. Looks like 6 year old kids designed and made these. A big waste of money, don't even consider buying it. Just save yourself the hassle of throwing it away and just throw your $25 in the garbage, then buy something else from someone else. My grandson is learning nothing from this. I taught him more with 2 spoons and with a metal bucket and a stick.
customer_reviews.author: Oon Suan

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: As with pretty much all Melissa and Doug items we've gotten for our toddler, these are sturdy, educational, allow for him to explore and create on his own. There are also enough goodies in the package for us all to play together! It has been quite fun! Cons: The kazoo didn't work at all in our box and the xylophone doesn't really make much sound since it's wooden being hit with a squared mallet. That was s little weird, but the concepts are still there.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: band set
customer_reviews.text: This is the second band set I have purchased. Melissa & Doug toys are durable. I appreciate that theey arrived in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny

customer_reviews.title: Pure Junk
customer_reviews.text: The xylophone doesn't even make sound - I mean, clapping books together makes more music. I guess the harmonic works, but nobody can get the kazoo to work. Please open the package and let it air for a few weeks. All the wood outgasses something fierce.
customer_reviews.author: QT Moth

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This looks like it would be so fun BUT several of the instrument basically don't work. The xylophone has no discernible notes and the finger clap cymbals don't really open and close. Love the wood and the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Zimney

customer_reviews.title: Our Grandson's First Hands on Musical Experience...and Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy to introduce a very young toddler to sounds and rhythms. Our one year old grandson is having a blast making sounds and having mom and dad participate with the wind instruments. Lots of room to grow with these musical toys.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great set, a few things I did not like
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. only a few things I did not like about it. The stick used to strike the xylophone was a square block on a long skinny stick. I think if it were round the sound would be better. Also the wooden (I guess finger symbols) were held together with a high grade elastic, but I can see that wearing out at some point. They all had good sounds, the Xylophone was in tune. My son loves playing with it, and it can take the hard beating being given to it.
customer_reviews.author: G.A. Central Texas

customer_reviews.title: Musical
customer_reviews.text: The Grandkids loved these musical instruments and their parents made sure to send them home with the grandparents for their weekly visits
customer_reviews.author: Marcia H

customer_reviews.title: The xylophone has terrible sound. Dead
customer_reviews.text: Debated between one and two stars. The harmonica is ok, as is the cymbal thing. The xylophone has terrible sound. Dead. Barely discernable as notes. What is up with the padding under the keys. Deadens it even more. The kazoo also has a terrible sound. Castinets are ok, but it is hard to mess those up. Don't buy this set. Not nearly worth it. Only Melissa and Doug product I have ever hated this much.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Lots of sound and fun
customer_reviews.text: Very durable! I bought this for my 2 year old son and he enjoys making lots of noise and music with the instruments!
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, not so much for parents
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my nieces and they both love it. My younger (18months old) niece dances when the older one (10yrs) plays the harmonica. They are having a great time it. Their mom, however, I feel sorry for. As if their place wasn't noisy enough with 2kids.
customer_reviews.author: S. Singh

customer_reviews.title: 1 faulty instrument :(
customer_reviews.text: So I love everything this came with but the gazoo doesn't work when you blow into it :(
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca McGuire

customer_reviews.title: This sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this purchase. The xylophone doesn't make any sound, the kazoo doesn't either. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: luv4shoes

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between this set and the others. I decided this one because our daughter asked for a xylophone. When I opened it I was surprised at the size and weight. These are VERY well made, not cheap or thin. Great quality as expected, but much better than I imagined. She has played them daily since Christmas and even plays 2-3 at a time. She's pretty awesome on the harmonica too:)
customer_reviews.author: TheMrsW

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It looks good but the quality of sound is very bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and are kazoo ok good. The other 2 suck
customer_reviews.text: The tamborine, harmonica, and are kazoo ok good. The other 2 suck. The xylophone is wooden so it doesnt make any noise
customer_reviews.author: Vimal Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: great but unfinished
customer_reviews.text: my son plays with this set but the wood is unfinished and the flute doesn't work...but over all it's freat and NOT to loud!!!
customer_reviews.author: nijaskyhi

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of these instruments although musically they don't do much. I like that they're not very loud. My girls love the harmonica, but the kazoo is pretty much worthless, it's almost impossible to get any sound out of it:(
customer_reviews.author: Korina

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: Very low quality. You get what you pay for...I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Zemuron

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in quality. Cheap construction. Not in tune. Xylophone has no resonance. Expected more from this company. Would return if I still had the box.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Zak

customer_reviews.title: and he loved it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 2 year old nephew at the time. It's very well made; and he loved it
customer_reviews.author: Diane T

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a christmas toy drive gift--I hope the child recipient enjoys it! I would this toy again for ages 2-3 and up.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter's birthday and she loves it! We had a little paint come off of one of the clam-like clap things (very little and it was our fault...I dropped it on a hard floor). Other than that, no problems. It was shipped very well and was received with no defects of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Noisy !!!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this toy and the fact that it made a lot of noise. He just turned one and the 'instruments' were easy for him to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Music - M&D
customer_reviews.text: I baught this set for a 4 year old for Christmas. Her mom has told me her daughter loves the hermonica and the quality was sound! Colorful and entertaining!! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: jkbryan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this set--the wood splintered and I didn't think it was appropriate for an infant. In general, the quality was poor--
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, sturdy, simple, well loved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a 1yo, and he soon figured out how to use the xylophone, i was quite impressed. The materials and quality look very nice and sturdy, I hope it gives hours of fun for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: And the xylophone is not of best quality either
customer_reviews.text: the small bazuka or whatever you call it doesn't function at all. And the xylophone is not of best quality either. Expected better from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: P. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Bought because son loved a friends harmonic but I think this one isnt as fun because ita really big so he has a hard time using it right now.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: pick something else
customer_reviews.text: We were not impressed. The set is pretty lame. The instruments are boring and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two year old cousin for Christmas, and she loves it! She opened it up right away and started playing on all the instruments. The instruments themselves are made very well. My cousin plays with this set almost daily (quite roughly, might I add) and it has definitely stood up to all the abuse! Fantastic gift for small children.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old loves this set! He isn't able to use the kazoo or harmonica yet, but he loves play the xylophone and shake the tamborine while I play the harmonica. It's fun for the whole family. When I first opened the package I thought it was a little strange that the xylophone is all wood(I was expecting metal bars. It took a little while to get used to the sound of the wooden bars compared with metal. My only complaint is that some of the paint has chipped off of the green bar after a couple weeks of use. Otherwise a great way to introduce your child to the world of instrumental music!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Faith

customer_reviews.title: My grand niece enjoyed this set
customer_reviews.text: My grand niece enjoyed this set. She gave each of us an instrument and directed us to perform when she was 4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Lessa O'Pern

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Deluxe Beginner Band Set
product_meta.description:
Style:English OnlyGot music? Everything needed for a solo performance or to form a marching band. Features a xylophone, a kazoo, castanets, a harmonica and a jingle stick in a wooden crate! Ideal for involving preschoolers in the musical experience.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: Includes a kazoo, a harmonica, a xylophone, a jingle stick and castanets
